author: xccj
title: A Nice Jet Airplane and Helicopter
review:
This Creator set features instructions for three models: a jet airplane, a helicopter, and a speed boat.  It has a good amount of pieces: 130 for roughly $13 USD.  Not bad.

 

First off, I’ll touch on the pieces.  It has a good selection of yellow plates, wedges, and some slopes.  The other highlights would be the three wheels and the dark blue wedge plates and tiles.  It doesn’t have an overabundance of any particular piece, but it’s still a nice selection to add to your collection.

 

I only built two of the models; the airplane and the helicopter.  The airplane uses almost all the pieces in the set.  It has a nice sleek design, and the wheels can be angled down as landing gear or pulled up and hidden away.  It’s a great build, with a nice color scheme (the dark blue highlights are great) and very swoosh-able.

 

The helicopter was the second model I build.  Some of the designs are very similar to the airplane, but it still manages to be rather unique on its own.  The color flow isn’t quite as nice, but it also has the rotating blades, which add to play value.  Another good model.

 

Sadly, the third model, a speed boat, just looks horrible.  It has an uneven mesh of wedges, and the color flow just isn’t as good as the other two models.  The rotating engines on the back look okay, but it’s not enough make up for the rest of the model.  The image of it was so unimpressive that I decided not to build it and just keep my plane model intact.

 

Overall, this set has a bunch of nice pieces at a nice price, and 2 of the 3 models are pretty good.  Anyways, this is part of the Creator theme, so if you don’t like the official models, just go build something of your own.  If you could use these parts in your collection, or if you want a cool plane model on display, then this is a good set to grab.  Just don’t get it for the speed boat.

author: tkettle9719
title: Air Show Remembrance!
review:
I just got this set at my Target using a Gift Card, and am quite pleased by this little set. It's a reasonably priced set, very smooth, and reminds me of air shows I used to go to, since I lived in a military city. I've only built the plane, and that is probably the only way I will build it.

Pros

  • -The landing gear is excellently used, and is honestly a very simple solution that could have been quite overdone.
  • -The plane is quite sleek, and slender. Very nice and small, but bigger than I had expected it to be. 
  • -The many angle pieces are excellent, seeing as I (and many) can never have too many of these in their collection.

Cons

  • -While it is sturdy for smaller children, the build did have some small glitches with instability, but they are all quite minor.
  • -The color scheme has disappointed me for the first time ever in a Lego set; it's almost ugly, in a sense, but it does have its accuracy points.
  • -The landing gear, although I said it was very nice, is unsymmetrical, because the wheel in the front is towards the left of the plane when looking at the plane from the front.

I love Creator for its simplistic beauty, and the nice sets they produce with such common bricks. This set is in no way an exception to the Creator philosophy. I highly recommend this for children, but it almost feels like a display set due to the limited playability. Still very nice for anyone to have.

author: n_zone
title: Top Gun
review:
This Creator set is very good, especially if you like jets and helicopter. It is a reasonably priced set (AUD $16) and it has cool features such as landing gear. Super Soarer delivers that sense of speed by making the model look fast and sleek

Pros

  • Pro 1: Functional landing gear
  • Pro 2: Jet is sturdy 
  • Pro 3: Helicopter looks very cool
  • Pro 4: the jet and attack helicopter looks cool and sleek.

Cons

  • Con 1: The boat
  • Con 2: The jet can look awkward in certain angles


If you feel the need for the speed, then get this set! I could give it 8.5 out of ten but I have to round it off to 10

author: bridgitkbruce
title: Great relatively easy but challenging build for the beginner.
review: My just turned 5 year old son got this set for his birthday. He was able to follow and build the jet with very little assistance. The jet is sturdy, and has endured hours of play carrying minifigs on its wings and has not yet needed to be rebuilt or repaired.
